description: Write n in decimal, omit 0's, replace the k-th digit d[k] by the k-th prime, raised to d[k]-th power and multiply.
comments: Not the same as A189398: see formula.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
prog: (Haskell)a061509 n = product $ zipWith (^)  a000040_list (map digitToInt $ filter (/= '0') $ show n)-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 03 2011(PARI) A061509(n)=prod(k=1,#n=select(t->t,digits(n)),prime(k)^n[k]) \\ _M. F. Hasler_, Aug 16 2014
author: _Amarnath Murthy_, May 06 2001
extensions: Corrected and extended by _Matthew Conroy_, May 13 2001
Definition corrected by _M. F. Hasler_, Aug 16 2014
